free_text.Learning outcomes: Learn how to solve concrete problems using theoretical and numerical methods of applied mathematics.
free_text.Content: [b]Linear algebra[/b][br/]Norm, dot product, orthogonality. Solution of linear systems: general properties, matrix decomposition. Diagonalization: theory and numerical methods.[br/][br/][b]Interpolation, smoothening[/b][br/]Least squares, polynomial interpolation.[br/][br/][b]Ordinary differential equations[/b][br/]Higher-order equations, systems of equations. Initial value problems. Analytical methods. Euler methods. Stability of numerical methods. Boundary value problems. Examples.[br/][br/][b]Fourier series and transform[/b][br/]Trigonometrical Fourier series. Impropre integral, convolution. Application to partial differential equations.[br/][br/]
free_text.Type of teaching: Ex cathedra lecture, exercises in the classroom
